definition: to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
surname Ye
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
to close up shop and cease business temporarily/closed for business

sentences.english: We're finding that businesses who have bedbugs oftentimes will close to remediate the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现，经常闹臭虫的企业得歇业来处理这个问题。

sentences.english: He only traded for a few months and went out of business because he was undercapitalized.
sentences.chinese: 他仅经商数月，便由于投资不足而歇业。

sentences.english: The practice of new to the company plant represents municipal government of Suzhou of delegate of week person character congratulation.
sentences.chinese: 周人言代表姑苏市政府对公司新工厂的歇业暗示祝贺。

sentences.english: The firm closed business for the time of the holiday.
The factory is shut down or failed to pay wages.
sentences.chinese: 关厂歇业或无法依劳动契约给付工作报酬。

sentences.english: The closeout of an enterprise means the enterprise has permanently ceased its business activities.
sentences.chinese: 企业歇业是指企业停止经营活动且不再继续。

sentences.english: The shop is closed for three weeks.
Sunday was known as the day of rest, when the shops were shut and businesses closed.
sentences.chinese: 听说日曜日是休息日，市肆都关门歇业。

sentences.english: Closeout of an enterprise is a form of termination of an enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 企业歇业是企业终止的一种情形。

definition: to cease trading (temporarily or permanently)/to close down
to close shop in the evening/also pr. [da3 yang2]
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
to do business/to trade
to go bankrupt/to close down
to have a full house/to be sold out/no vacancy
to open a business/first transaction of a business day
the people are gone and the place is empty (idiom)/the sight of a deserted place brings old friends to mind/the place is deserted/the birds have flown
to open a business/to open a practice/open (for business)
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
half-open door/fig. prostitute
lit. General Iron is guarding the door (idiom)/fig. the door is padlocked — nobody inside
to stop work/to shut down/to stop production
to declare bankruptcy
(of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
